summaryText: Wow, what an incredible Palm Sunday message from Pastor Travis Hearn about preparing our hearts for Holy Week! PT delivered a powerful sermon focused on three key aspects of spiritual preparation: Go and Invite, Give and Invest, and Grow and Ignite. He challenged us to see this week as sacred, not just ordinary, and to intentionally engage with God's purpose. Pastor Travis emphasized the importance of inviting others to church, especially for Easter, reminding us that the Great Commission is for every believer, not just pastors. He broke down practical ways to grow spiritually this week - reading God's word, reflecting on Scripture, reciting verses, and genuinely repenting. The most powerful moment was when he encouraged everyone to see this week as an opportunity to draw closer to Jesus, to prepare our hearts for the resurrection, and to truly understand the depth of God's love and sacrifice. PT's passionate call to action wasn't just about religious ritual, but about transforming our lives and sharing the incredible good news of Jesus Christ.
mainPoints: Go and Invite others to experience Jesus
Give and Invest in God's Kingdom

versesMentioned.text: Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.
For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
But God demonstrates his own love for us in this: While we were still sinners, Christ died for us.

Command those who are rich in this present world not to be arrogant nor to put their hope in wealth, which is so uncertain, but to put their hope in God, who richly provides us with everything for our enjoyment. Command them to do good, to be rich in good deeds, and to be generous and willing to share. In this way they will lay up treasure for themselves as a firm foundation for the coming age, so that they may take hold of the life that is truly life.

Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moths and vermin destroy, and where thieves break in and steal. But store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where moths and vermin do not destroy, and where thieves do not break in and steal. For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
He said to them, 'Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation.'
All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness, so that the servant of God may be thoroughly equipped for every good work.
Keep this Book of the Law always on your lips; meditate on it day and night, so that you may be careful to do everything written in it. Then you will be prosperous and successful.
I can do all this through him who gives me strength.
I have hidden your word in my heart that I might not sin against you.

If my people, who are called by my name, will humble themselves and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven, and I will forgive their sin and will heal their land.

Monday.scripture: Matthew 6:21: 'For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.'
Monday.action: Reflect on how you currently invest your time, resources, and energy. Create a list of priorities and evaluate if they align with God's purpose for your life.
Monday.prayer: Lord, reveal to me where my true treasure lies. Help me align my heart with Your will and purpose. Guide me to invest in things that matter eternally. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Mark 16:15: 'Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation.'
Tuesday.action: Identify one person in your life who needs to hear about Jesus. Prepare a thoughtful, compassionate way to share your faith with them this week.
Tuesday.prayer: God, give me courage and wisdom to share Your love. Help me be a light in someone's darkness and an instrument of Your hope. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Joshua 1:8: 'Keep this Book of the Law always on your lips; meditate on it day and night.'
Wednesday.focus: Developing a consistent Scripture reading habit
Wednesday.action: Download a Bible app and set up a daily reading plan. Choose a book (Matthew recommended) and commit to reading one chapter daily.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, open my heart to understand Your Word. Help me not just read, but truly meditate on and apply Your teachings. Transform me from the inside out. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: 2 Timothy 3:16-17: 'All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness.'
Thursday.action: Choose a verse that challenges or convicts you. Write it down, memorize it, and reflect on how it can change your perspective or behavior.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, use Your Word to refine me. Show me areas where I need correction and growth. Help me be humble and receptive to Your guidance. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Philippians 4:13: 'I can do all this through him who gives me strength.'
Friday.action: Identify a personal challenge or goal that seems overwhelming. Commit to approaching it with prayer and the belief that God will provide strength.
Friday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I trust in Your power. Where I am weak, be my strength. Help me to rely on You in every circumstance. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: 2 Chronicles 7:14: 'If my people... will humble themselves and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in honest self-reflection. Identify areas of sin or resistance in your life. Journal about these and pray for genuine transformation.
Saturday.prayer: God, reveal the places in my heart that need healing. Give me the courage to turn away from sin and fully embrace Your restoration. Make me new. Amen.
